metadata.title: CVE-2023-38470 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Avahi. A reachable assertion exists in theavahi_escape_label() function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38470` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

avahi-autoipd - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
avahi-daemon - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
avahi-discover - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
avahi-dnsconfd - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
avahi-ui-utils - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
avahi-utils - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
gir1.2-avahi-0.6 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-client3 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-common-data - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-common3 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-compat-libdnssd1 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-core7 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-glib1 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-gobject0 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
libavahi-ui-gtk3-0 - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
python-avahi - 0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: avahi package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7-3.1ubuntu1.3+esm2').
